Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with two added red bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The lack of decoration on the sherd may be due to its size; it may well have come from an undecorated part of a Chalice Style, Black Figure Komast or Black Figure Animal chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1235) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
